intro: Leptodactylon jaegeri, commonly known as the Jaeger's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy texture. The flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, a characteristic feature of the Euphorbiaceae family.
